data.title: Pervasive sloppy initialization order
data.body:
Sorted and uniqed list of warnings about potentially incorrect initialization order. There are a ton of these, and while most of them are probably harmless, a few are probably bugs, and the sheer volume is masking actually problematic issues.
[field_order_errors_uniq.txt](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/files/688751/field_order_errors_uniq.txt)

data.title: Pervasive misuse of virtual
data.body:
Here's a sorted + uniqed list of warnings related to misuse of `virtual`. Most of these are overloads that should probably be overrides, but there's also a handful of higher priority issues where classes with virtual members have non-virtual destructors, which is a recipe for unhappiness.

[virtual_errors_uniq.txt](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/files/688739/virtual_errors_uniq.txt)

data.title: Casting 32bit values to pointers in a 64bit build
data.body: A lot of the netcode unpack stuff is turning `U32`s into pointers, and it's scaring the crap out of me.

data.title: checkToggleState macro has dangling else.
data.body:
```
#define CHECK_TOGGLE_STATE(state, enum) if(!oldState || oldState->mDesc.state != mDesc.state) if(mDesc.state) glEnable(enum); else glDisable(enum)
```
 is used in three places (defined in `gfxGLStateBlock.cpp`), and needs the addition of at least one set of curly braces. I'm fairly sure that `else` should be attached to the inner `if`, but a second pair of eyes would be good.

data.title: Removed deprecated use of register keyword from the TorqueScript lexer/parser
data.body: Clang was complaining because using `register` as a storage specifier is deprecated (and disallowed in modern C++). This might crop up again in the future if somebody regenerates the parser.

data.title: OSX de-deprecation (profiler and macFileIO)
data.body: Fixed a number of deprecated API usages on OS X, as well as made the move and copy operations share a bit more code, and both a bit safer.

data.title: console.log really ought to end up in the user data directory
data.body: I understand that for building and debugging purposes it's pretty convenient to have console.log in the same directory as everything else, but when building to deploy to end users it's a really poor design choice to assume the application will be able to write to its own directory. I've written code to handle this before, but I'm not sure everyone would appreciate it as a unilateral "upgrade". Perhaps some configuration can be set at compile time? It would be good to get some feedback on this, and if people are in agreement I can make a PR with appropriate changes.

Relevant [console.txt](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/files/688064/console.txt) is also attached.

data.title: Fix net tests
data.body: There was a silly error where a bunch of Net::sm* stuff was being declared as standalone static variables rather than as static members.

data.title: Physics timing
data.body:
Allows tuning of the physics substeps and step time. Bullet before was using the default of 1 substep. Potentially these would be good values to have in the levelInfo so they can be tuned on a per level basis depending on the physics needs of that level.

Thanks @JeffProgrammer for pointing out the bullet side, never noticed it before.

data.title: Added _physicsEnabled() function to Player class
data.body: This PR allows you to move the player around in the editor with a physics plugin when you don't have the simulation enabled (default for the editor)

data.title: Physx 2.8 removal
data.body: Removes physx 2.8 physics module. Physx 2.8 is deprecated and hasn't been supported by Nvidia for a number of years now.

data.title: PhysicsShape applyTorque function
data.body: Adds applyTorque console function to PhysicsShape

data.title: Physx3.3 updates
data.body:
Adds cmake support for physx 3.3 on windows.
Fixes a bug with PxRenderBuffer and debug drawing

I do also have physx 3.4 code updated and a cmake module (works on win/linux/mac) ready to go as soon as nvidia officially release physx 3.4

data.title: PhysicsShapeData examples
data.body: Simple examples of PhysicsShapeData usage for the full template.

data.title: enable video recording
data.body: EDIT: sry I forgot to add a description..... this add a better function of the video recording and add a shortcut.

data.title: feature request "metrics( texture )"
data.body:
would be nice to have  

metrics( texture )

How many texture loaded, texture memory....

data.title: ShadowViz broken
data.body:
I tested ShadowViz in v3.9 with a point of light and is totally black, with the sun I don't have problem.

In v3.8 is fine
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1057449/21582268/0ef5c2e2-d016-11e6-8579-bf44d971284f.png)

data.title: D3D11 shadermodel version fix
data.body:
*Fixes up a problem where shader model version was not getting set for shader macros.
*Adds feature level string to the version string of the card profiler.

data.title: added torque SimView tool
data.body:
This tool display a list of all game objects, SimObject, SimGroup, and SimSet instances

![2016-12-28_15-30-28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1057449/21532127/ddab55e0-cd12-11e6-9495-8de03aaac43a.png)

![t3d_2016-12-28_15-32-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1057449/21532131/e6911eba-cd12-11e6-95f5-83e0beb29dd4.png)

data.title: Bullet 2.85 update
data.body:
Updates libbullet to 2.85
Fix potential crash with BtPlayer::_stepForward

data.title: brings empty up to date for core and shader dirs
HDR review: remove from reflections, kill depth check, order of ops
looks like getsockname needs a slightly different signature for crossplat support
Game not launching correctly
data.body:
http://pastebin.com/WzBHWUR6

^

Game window opens, but blank
This issue occurred in Uebergame, with the latest release of the engine.
Developer assured me it was an engine problem

data.title: DX11 updates
data.body:
Various updates i been meaning to chuck in for ages:
* Caching sampler states
* Better tracking of sampler ranges in use for binding time
* Feature level 10 & 10.1 support
* Full-screen fix where window has no focus on startup
* Don't add DX11 adapters to the adapter list when they are not supported by the system (causes a crash when selected)
* D3DPER debug events
